Task 1: Read data, parse, construct data frame
```{r}
library(stringr)
d=readLines("~cr173/Sta523/data/world_cup_goals_raw.txt")

pid <- unlist(str_match_all(d," pid=\"([0-9]*)\""))[seq(2,194,2)]
mid <- unlist(str_match_all(d," mid=\"([0-9]*)\""))[seq(2,194,2)]
name <- unlist(str_match_all(d, ignore.case(" pname=\"([a-z &;']*)\"")))[seq(2,194,2)]

#pteam=\"Cameroon\"
Team=str_match_all(d, ignore.case(" pteam=\"([a-z &;']*)\""))
#ptime=\"26\" 
Time=str_match_all(d, " ptime=\"([0-9]*)\"")
#paddtime=\"0\" 
AddedTime=str_match_all(d, " paddtime=\"([0-9]*)\"")
#ptype=\"goal\"
GoalType=str_match_all(d, ignore.case(" ptype=\"([a-z]*[a-z -]*)\""))

# Andrew: I first set the criteria for [str_match_all] to use. Then, I move the matching elements of the data frame into a single vector with [unlist]. Lastly, I return the relevant atomic vectors, which alternates as every other element in my new vector beginning at i=2 until the last element, n=386.
pteamimg.criteria <- "pteamimg=\"([a-z]*/[a-z]*.[a-z]*)\""
pteamimg <- unlist(str_match_all(d, pteamimg.criteria))[seq(2,386,2)]
pmatch.criteria <- "pmatch=\"([0-9]*)\""
pmatch <- unlist(str_match_all(d, pmatch.criteria))[seq(2,386,2)]
style.criteria <- "style=\"([a-z]*[:][ ][0-9]*[a-z]*[;][ ][a-z]*[:][ ][0-9]*[a-z]*[;])\""
style <- unlist(str_match_all(d, style.criteria))[seq(2,386,2)]
```
